title: Chief Complaint
content: Evaluation of left small finger with locking and catching; tethering with finger flexion.
instruction: Provide only the chief complaints without additional details.

title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient first noticed locking and catching in the left small finger two years ago. He avoided seeking treatment due to previous trigger finger surgeries but now desires evaluation. On exam, the left small finger shows moderate tenderness to palpation with a nodule at the trigger point, limiting range of motion. Well-healed incisions are noted on the middle finger. X-rays are normal.
instruction: Summarize HPI focusing on onset, duration, location, severity, mechanism, treatments, and progression.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Left small finger skin is purging without erythema; moderate tenderness to palpation; nodule at trigger point; excellent range of motion overall; well-healed trigger finger incisions to the middle finger.

title: Imaging Results
content: X-rays normal for left small finger.

title: Assessment
instruction: List active problems or conditions relevant to the visit.

title: Plan
content: Planned trigger finger surgery; gentle advancement of activity and range of motion; follow-up video visit in one month if symptoms persist.
instruction: Write the doctor's plan as dictated.
